etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Reports of the British Association for the Advancement of Science. From German Quercin from English quercia + German -in -in

definitions: A bitter crystalline cyclic alcohol obtained from the bark and acorns of various species of oak, and found also in other plants.

notes.text: Quercin is a stereoisomer of hexahydroxycyclohexane; C₆H₁₂O₆. It is unlikely that the pure compound was isolated before the mid 20th century.
